related_post.text: Suppose I have 2 python scripts A and B. A uses C:\\python385\\python.exe as interpreter. B uses C:\\Anaconda\\python.exe. My objective is to doubleclick on the python file on Windows 10 then have the script run on the interpreter I want.Is there a convenient way to indicate the interpreter path inside the script? I am welcome to other methods to achieve my objective.I am using windows 10 python 3.8 anaconda distribution.

so_post.text: They are some very interesting informations here if you are interested https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15171695/whatswiththeintegercachemaintainedbytheinterpreter
